result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Lee Schaffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse Lee Schaffer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse Lee Schaffer was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Lee Schaffer

records.addlTxt:
9:43 AM Defendant Jesse Lee Schaffer in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jesse Lee Schaffer.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  State indicates defendant will plead to Count 1, recommend 45 days, stayed for 1 year probation, conditions of probation to include 2 days, 2 credit, DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs, dismiss Count 2, agree not to file bail jumping in police department case. 22SP04123. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court informs defendant of rights given up by plea.  Defendant understands. No objection to factual basis. Court finds defendant understands proceedings and plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives rights.  Factual basis exists.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed. Defendant makes statements.
Court orders 45 days imposed and stayed for 1 year, conditions of 2 days jail, 2 days credit, DOC programming, fine of $50 plus costs, domestic abuse surcharge. Payment plan for financial obligation.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 09:46 AM Defendant Jesse Lee Schaffer in court and not in-custody with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty indicates State has extended an offer. Counsel asserts he is new to the case and  hasn't had a chance to discuss the offer with his client. Counsel requests another Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse Lee Schaffer

Prior: 115 Belknap Street, Superior, WV 54880
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key

No contact with victims 1 and 2 or their address as listed in the ID Key, defendant is allowed a one time personal property retreival with the assistant of Law Enforcement, defendant must verify address within 24 hours upon release from jail

01:39 PM Defendant Jesse Lee Schaffer in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Jesse Lee Schaffer in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse Lee Schaffer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant gives Ruth House for alternative address.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Court accepts pleas of not guilty to misdemeanors and will schedule Status Conference with Judge Glonek.  States request on bail: $250 cash with conditions of no contact with victims 1 and 2 or their address as listed in the ID Key, defendant is allowed a one time personal property retreival with the assistant of the police. Atty Craker is requesting recognizance bond as the defendant is having a medical procedure done. Defendant has no money to post at this time. Court asks the State if any victim would like to address the Court at this time. State indicates that No victims would like to address the Court.
Court Orders $1000 signature bond with conditions of no contact with victims 1 and 2 or their address as listed in the ID Key, defendant is allowed a one time personal property retreival with the assistant of the police and Defendant must update his address within 24 hours of release from jail.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
